intro: Korthalsella wawrae, commonly known as the Wawra's korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually small and hairy, providing a unique texture and appearance. Korthalsella wawrae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological niche.
